TopicTitle: [1.6.x] Distant Object Enhancement bis v1.9.1.1 (16 October 2018) - Free to a Good Home

Articles.Content:

Do you have scatterer installed in 1.4.1? Because that’s a scatterer bug in 1.4.1.

I know this is not released for 1.4.1 yet, but is it normal that on the dark side of Kerbin no single star is visible, only the moons and the distant planets?
(this is when already low in the atmosphere so no light could disturb the sight)
I turned dynamic dimming off btw...

Edit:

I managed it to work:
I also enabled dynamic sky dimming and set the max. brightness to 72% - which is also the value I made the Envmaps darker than the original skybox textures...

Because I use

to have my own skybox, I just had the idea that I also could need Envmaps for the skybox - and it works!

To compare, this is in SPC at night (this also worked somehow before, without Envmaps):

Spoiler

And this is how it looks shortly after launch at ~16,000m altitude at about the same time (now it works, thank to the Envmaps):

Spoiler

DOE seems to run perfectly well in 1.4.1

@MOARdV I posted an issue at scatterer because with the new version there is this problem that also this mod is involved in.

Spoiler

 

  • With scatterer and Distant Object Enhancement I don't see the skybox at night sky from SPC or at the launchpad at all
  • Without scatterer but with Distant Object Enhancement I have to disable the Dynamic Sky Dimming to get the skybox visible at night sky from SPC or launchpad

PlanetShine is also installed.

I suggest that this mod allows showing the skybox from the planet surface or low altitude when still on the night side of the planet and no sunrise or sunset in sight ...

i have sky dimming only when i pass in front off the all so i have in some moments the sky dimmed at nigni side of kerbin beouse i have the all (old sun location) bihind me

any solutions?

Herp derp, course they wouldn't work in map mode.

I have a few questions. First, I understand skybox dimming, but why do no stars appear at night on kerbin?

Second, is there any way to increase the distance beyond 750000? 

Third, Saturation doesn't seem to do anything for me. Why?

Edited August 9, 2018 by Rusted Iron

7 hours ago, Rusted Iron said:

I have a few questions. First, I understand skybox dimming, but why do no stars appear at night on kerbin?

Very likely a bug.  I have been very busy with other mods in my spare time, so I have not looked at this mod in about a year.

7 hours ago, Rusted Iron said:

Second, is there any way to increase the distance beyond 750000? 

Right now, it requires changing the source code and rebuilding.  750km was selected as a reasonable number for most vessels in orbit over stock Kerbin (except maybe large space stations).  One problem with increasing the distance is that the flare size may become smaller than 1 pixel on the screen, which will cause it to flicker, depending on anti-aliasing settings.

7 hours ago, Rusted Iron said:

Third, Saturation doesn't seem to do anything for me. Why?

Saturation affects only body colors (the planet / moon flares). Vessel flares are always white.  Flare saturation only takes effect when starting Flight - if you change it while in Flight, it will not do anything until you go to the Space Center or Tracking Station.
How do I configure a Kopernicus Planet Pack to work with this mod?

On 9/17/2018 at 5:56 AM, DerpzGames said:

How do I configure a Kopernicus Planet Pack to work with this mod?

I'm sorry I didn't see this question earlier.  I've been pretty busy.

If you look in GameData/DistantObject/PlanetColors.cfg, you will see the basic format for coloring a flare, eg: 

CelestialBodyColor
{
	name = Kerbin
	color = 73,99,121
}

This lists the name of the body (the non-localized name) and the R, G, B color triplet that the flare should use.

To add your own flares, create a config file somewhere (with the planet pack, if you're releasing the planet pack) and add CelestialBodyColor entries for each of the worlds you want to have custom colors.  And body that does not have a custom color will have the default color of white (255, 255, 255).

I've released Distant Object Enhancement v1.9.1.1.  This is a recompile against KSP 1.5.0, but the mod may still work with 1.3.x and 1.4.x.  There are no functional changes, so if you're on one of the older versions of KSP, don't feel compelled to update (actually, you probably don't need to update for KSP 1.5.0).

Also: DOE is free to a good home.  I will not be updating it again any time in the foreseeable future.

I've made no code changes to it for over a year.  I know there is at least one bug related to the sky dimming effect (while on the surface) that's been in the mod throughout the KSP 1.4.x period.  The sky dimming code in DarkenSky.cs could stand to have a scrubbing and refactoring, but I don't have the motivation to do it.  I have barely played KSP since 1.4.0 released - almost every time I started KSP in 1.4.x was for modding purposes. It's time I collect a few parts mods and visual mods and spend some time simply playing the game, instead of spending countless hours tweaking and debugging code and IVAs.  At least, once I have time to revisit KSP for any length of time.

Go have some fun, that is what we are all here for. Im all for mods taking some time off to just enjoy what they have worked so hard on. TY for all you do.

Edited October 16, 2018 by Kevin Kyle
